review.reviewBody:
This is my go to all-round crampon for 3 season use in the Cascades. It's light, sturdy, and the 12 point design inspires confidence on icier starts. Works well for everything from late season laps on Rainier to spring ascents in the Cascades. 

May not be the best option for steeper technical ice, but I would consider this essential to my kit for glaciers and steep snow.
review.name: Excellent 3 Season Workhorse

review.itemreviewed: Canyon SPD Mountain Bike Shoe - Women's
Canyon SPD Mountain Bike Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Overall seems like a good clip in shoe, but shoes were returned.  I was hoping with the lace up style it would fit my high instep.  Unfortunately there is a 1/4” strip of elastic that goes over the instep, this caused me pain after a few minutes.  It looks like it could possibly be expanded a bit by snipping some stitching and releasing a small loop.  I didn’t want to alter the shoe and not be able to return it.  Guess I didn’t like them enough to give it a try.  Be sure to use the sizing chart for correct length.
review.name: Not for high instep

name: Canyon SPD Mountain Bike Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've got multiple figure 9's to tie down lumber, sheet goods, kayaks and or any gear.
review.name: Quick, dependable and easy

review.reviewBody: I really like the Nite Ize Figure 9s, Figure 9 carabiners, and Cam Jams. I don't have to try to remember knots or how to tie them. For someone with limited motor skills they are incredibly useful for securing loads, tents, tarps, etc.

review.reviewBody:
Unfortunatly this product is not able to hold a standard 4mm paracord. The rope just slips through when increasing tension. There is nothing to secure the loose part.
Only way to make it hold is to tie an extra loop or slipknot on the loose end.
review.name: Does not hold

review.reviewBody: Been  using the plastic 9s for years on my hammock tarps with no problem. Saw the aluminum ones & got some. They work just as well. Fair price ordered straight from company. Easy to use. Lite & do the job. I recommend them.

review.name: Like a potato chip you can’t have just one...

review.reviewBody: I use Watershed duffels on 1000+ river miles per year and never had a leak or tear. Lube the seal once or twice per year and you’re good to go. I’ve had roll-top bags fail but not these. Essential gear.
review.name: These duffels are bomber

review.reviewBody: I purchased the bag this spring to use whitewater rafting and used it on numerous spring runs. I primarily use it to carry my rope and rescue gear on my raft. Watershed bags are great and keep the contents 100% dry. I have other bags from this brand and recommend them 100%! The bag fits 200' of static line along with webbing and other gear. I also use it inflatable kayaking for dry storage clothing. It is nice as there are plenty of lash points to secure the bag to rafts and IKs.
review.name: Great small/medium dry bag

name: Chattooga 22L Dry Bag

review.reviewBody: Great fit - I'm 6'3" 210 and a large fits perfectly. I have been getting rid of my baggy flannels and replacing them with OR flannels. This model is medium weight but breathes well, never overheats. Material is solid and doesn't shrink or fade.  The buttons aren't great, the shirts do not button/unbutton easily.  Love the lifetime warranty.
review.name: My favorite flannels

review.reviewBody: Haven't had an opportunity to wear yet, but after trying it on i can say that it is warm, well made, and runs a little large.
review.name: Runs a little large

review.reviewBody: Soft and warm AF. Get one yesterday. I have one in every color except that nasty orange one
review.name: Like a friendly hug

review.reviewBody: Very soft, doesn't wrinkle, high quality material. The reason for the 4 out of 5 star review is that the shirt (size L) is a bit tight across my shoulders when extending my my arms out in front of me. An XL would fix the problem, but would then be too big/long in other parts of the shirt. I'm 6'0", 190lbs and have an athletic fit.
review.name: A great shirt, but not quite perfect.

review.reviewBody: This is one of my favorite shirts to wear when the weather starts getting colder. It is fairly thick and warm and it is well made. This is my second of this style after getting the blue one and loving it so much.
review.name: My favorite cold weather shirt.

review.reviewBody: Cozy, well-built, wrinkle-resistant, and nice-fitting flannel shirt. Two thumbs up!
review.name: The Feedback Flannel Delivers!

review.reviewBody:
The Feedback Flannel Twill shirt is very comfortable, fits well, and looks great. I'm 5'6" with broad shoulders and a short torso - I have a tough time finding flannels that fit me right. They tend to be either too long or too tight across the chest. This shirt fits very well and the fabric is incredibly soft. 

The only thing I don't love is that the back isn't pleated, so the shirt doesn't "give" as much as I like.
Have worn this a handful of times camping this summer and it's a good weight for chillier days/ cooler nights. All around a solid medium weight flannel
review.name: Good medium weight flannel

review.reviewBody: It's super warm, super soft, looks good. It also does well if you get hot and sweaty, drying quickly. It's just next level compared to any other flannel I've ever worn. It's my favorite shirt in winter, or I should say all of them I've bought so I have different colors are all my favorite warm shirts. Wear these almost as a light jacket in Texas or under a winter jacket in Colorado.
review.name: I own a LOT of these now

review.reviewBody: The perfect flannel shirt. Washes with no shrinkage and doesn't need the iron! Sizing is spot on. Warm, thick and soft.
review.name: The Perfect Flannel Shirt

name: Feedback Flannel Twill Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought this as an outer layer for winter / early season road riding. The fit is great and I like the large back pockets. The arms could be a bit longer. It is VERY warm, partly because of the highly effective wind blocking. Thus, with a winter bib and a single synthetic under layer that does not provide any warmth itself, I still cannot wear this jacket much above 40-45 F, especially if its sunny. Solid addition to the wardrobe, but only for cold weather, because it is not packable.
review.name: Great fit - very warm - wind blocking

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my 6 year old daughter’s backpack. It is quite large for her, she is doing longer day hikes with us and just did her first 12,352 mountain. She needs more water than 1.5L, this is the this is the smallest pack that I could get to accomplish that need. 
It has ample room for 3L of water, lunch, rain gear, and first aid kit. She still has room to put pretty rocks she finds. I especially like the storage for trekking poles. 
I am looking for an 40L replacement pack for myself and Osprey is high on the list.
review.name: This is my 6 year

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was so excited to order this bag for short hikes in a hot climate. The pack will accommodate ample water and a few essentials without the bulk needed for cooler weather or longer treks. The red color is magnificent, and the pack has all the useful features of my Tempest 20 except for an adjustable harness. That said, the pack is best suited for shorter torsos. There is no way the pack would properly fit my 19-inch torso, and I question whether it would fit an 18-inch torso without the yoke hanging halfway down your back. I'd give the pack five stars if the harness is adjustable (the owner's manual claims the shoulder harness is adjustable, but this is not the case). Returned and ordered an 11L Talon.
review.name: I was so excited to

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best day pack ever! Holds a water bottle on each side for my dog and I use the bladder. A lot of storage. Very lightweight. I wear it every time I head for the hills.

review.reviewBody: I had to go up two sizes to  get my feet into the shoe.  I wear a women's 7.5-8 and had to buy a size 10 to get them on my feet.  After a few months of climbing, they were so stretched out that when my feet got sweaty they slid around inside the shoe, even with the velcro straps as tight as I could get them.  They also smell horrible, despite the shoe disinfectant.  It's a decent shoe, but I'd probably not buy this brand again.
review.name: Decent shoe

review.reviewBody: I normally wear women size 6.5, ordered a pair in size 7 after reading reviews. But they still ran small, my toes bent in a painful way inside the shoes. I have to return them. Size 7.5 might work better for me.
review.name: Run way too small

review.reviewBody: I ordered an 8.5. My true shoe size is usually an 8 and they fit my size 6 friend perfectly so they were more like a size 6.5 for her. I have to return them so I can’t speak to the performance.
review.name: Way too small

review.reviewBody: These were my first pair of climbing shoes ever! They are comfy, not too aggressive, but have great rubber. Definitely better for beginners.
review.name: Great beginner shoe

review.reviewBody:
I am a size 7.5 when it comes to regular sneakers, but I ordered a size 8 for these as I was not sure how tight climbing shoes were supposed to be. It fits snug, with some room in the heel area. Next time I order the same shoes, I would go with size 7.5 as I have been told by more experienced climbers that some discomfort is okay (and preferred) because you need the shoe to fit tightly for heel hooks. 
I have flat arches, these shoes are wide enough to accommodate my foot shape and very comfortable that I can keep them on for 1.5+ bouldering sessions. Overall I really like these shoes as a beginner
review.name: Great beginner shoes

review.reviewBody:
I love the look and once I got the right size the feel of these shoes. Order 1
Size up to get the correct size. I’m a true women’s 6 and ordered like the chart said but had to reorder the 7’s.
Item runs small, even after sizing up to accommodate.
I bought these a couple months ago and I love them. Very comfortable. I can stay in them all day so now they are my outdoor climbing shoe.
review.name: Elektra

name: Elektra Climbing Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: These goggles have changed my life as an elite swimmer.  The data shows in real time, which has helped me gauge my pace better.  I’m a competitive person, so I feed off of knowing my times and how well I’m doing on each set.  Without Form, I didn’t know my progress until after the entire session was over and I looked at my Apple Watch App and Training Peaks.  The goggles make me go harder and be more driven in the water.  I’ll never go back to using goggles without smart technology again.  I’ve shaved 38 seconds off my 750 meter time in just the few months that I’ve had these. They are also adjustable and will fit any size.  I use the small adapter, but it comes with many sizes so they don’t leak.  I can’t rave about them enough!
review.name: Game changer for training

review.reviewBody:
I absolutely love my new goggles! I am relatively new to swimming, and I love that these are crystal clear and help me keep track of my laps and split times. The included extra nose pieces help to adjust the fit perfectly to my face - one of my biggest pet peeves has been water entry in goggles. The great fit on these certainly helps to eliminate this for me. 
I love having my pace, distance and other swim stats displayed right in these goggles! It allows me to swim smarter each lap without stopping to check my watch.
While not training for a triathlon, they're perfect for my fitness routine. Highly recommend theses great goggles to fellow lap swimmers seeking an upgrade. The stats are super helpful and is giving me the data I need for that extra boost.
review.name: Love my new Goggles!

review.reviewBody:
I come from a cycling background and only recently decided to start swimming. Immediately, one of the challenges I was faced with was being able to get my workouts with data integrated. I never run without my running watch, and I don't bike without a bike computer. But swimming was another challenge altogether. Enter Form goggles. 

My current setup that I'm using these with is a Garmin Fenix watch and the Polar OH1+ HRM. I haven't quite had the chance to take the complete setup outside, but I can say that in a pool, the whole system works pretty well. There is a slight learning curve with how to get the watch and goggles to play well together, but once you have it, it's extremely cool to be able to look at your current lap time or heart rate while you're swimming. 

The extra nose pieces were an awesome touch as well. It took a few tries, just like any goggles, but you definitely have the ability to get the fit dialed on these to reduce any water coming in while you're swimming. 

Overall, I think these goggles provide something unique in the market for those data nerds out there who love to see how they're performing in real time. I definitely fall into that category, and for me, Form goggles totally hit the mark.
review.name: Makes my swimming feel like biking

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Well, got these a while back as an occasional shoe. I tend to buy a good walking shoe for walking, as in good walks, and have a pair of demoted shoes as dog walking shoes. Walking boots are amongst the few things in life I spend a bit on in the hope of finding quality, and looking after my feet etc.
Had these as occasional good walsk, probably been out 10 times in 6 months, the heel went as the material used is cheap. Behind the material is a horribly sharp heel, that cuts your feet no warning.
Had these replaced under warranty, the 2nd pair have done the exact same thing in less walks. Lost confidence in them, wouldn't wear them but even with minimal wear, the same thing has happened. They're in the bin now as I'm out of the 2 year warranty, but trust me when I say these were am occasional grippy shoe for a good walk. I've had gym trainers that I've battered a good few times a week that are still perfect. Stay away from these and I'd suggest this brand. They're cutting costs with cheap materials and your feet and bank ballance will pay the price.
review.name: Dreadful quality! Probably the worst I've owned.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Reserve 30 SL Alloy MX DT 350 Boost Wheelset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: 30 SL Alloy MX DT 350 Boost Wheelset
review.reviewBody:
I ride the Santa Cruz Bronson, which runs a mulleted wheelset (29" up front, 27.5" in the back). I've been wanting to upgrade my wheelset for awhile to an XD driver as well as a lighter setup, but could never justify the price point for carbon rims. I'm also an adamant rear cushcore user. I've dinged too many rear wheels to go without. 

I didn't realize you could order mixed wheelsets, but here they are! These weigh about the same as my husband's high-end carbon mtb wheelset, and I feel a bit more at ease if they get dinged (crossing my fingers). Easy to set up (obviously) and so far so good!
review.name: Stoked for a mullet wheelset!!

name: 30 SL Alloy MX DT 350 Boost Wheelset

review.itemreviewed: EQUIPE R HABU Winter Jacket S11 - Men's
review.reviewBody: This  is a great jacket. Tested it today on a frosty 28* F ride. Fits well, and does exactly what it's supposed to do....keeping you warm and dry in cold weather. I wore it with an Underarmour 3.0 baselayer shirt. I was comfortable and dry the entire 40 miles. I paired it with the Assos Mille GTO tights for an unbeatable winter combo. Yes, it's definitely an investment. Still, if you want to be toasty during winter rides, this jacket will check many if not all boxes.
review.name: Well worth it

hasVariant.description: Buy the Topo Designs Toposcape Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is one of my new favorite shirts. The organic cotton is natural and so, so soft and comfortable. The first is pretty much perfect and true to size, but it is definitely not an oversized fit. It's not tight either but it's closer to tight than to oversized, in my experience. Wear and bought an XL, if they had the XXL in stock I would buy it. For now I am getting another XL in black because it's on sale and half the price of other shirts of the same quality, and organic cotton 100%.

The fabric is not thick or thin, it's very soft and comfortable. The design is really modern and I love the way the sleeves look with the designs going down, overall the design is very neutral, but cool. Somehow loud, yet not, at the same time. Good job on this one Topo, glad I found it before you inevitably raise your prices when others find out about these shirts.
review.name: Truly Incredible Quality

name: Toposcape Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's

description: Buy the Specialized Body Geometry SL Footbeds online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Body Geometry SL Footbeds
hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Body Geometry SL Footbeds online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I swapped these into my main cycling shoes and they are definitely better than the insoles that came with the shoes (Adidas Gravel)
review.name: Nice Upgrade

review.reviewBody: Once I placed my order, the order information was correct except it left off the sizing.  It was only later that the sizing was included and ended up costing me double shipping and delay.  If I had seen the sizing information as soon as the order was processed and I was notified I could have made changes without the delay and shipping costs for return and placing a new order.
review.name: Order Information is Truncated
comment: We understand your frustration with the delay and additional shipping costs incurred due to the sizing information not being included in your initial order confirmation.  We've sent you an email to discuss how we can address this issue.

review.reviewBody: They work well.
review.name: Specialized BG SL footbeds

review.reviewBody: These worked as advertised.  They fit into a size 48 pair of Fiziks without having to be trimmed.  Before, the shoes got very uncomfortable after a few miles. Although not perfect, these insoles are a massive improvement. Longest ride, so far, is 40 miles. We'll see how they do as the mileage goes up. Recommended!
review.name: Surprisingly good

review.reviewBody: Didn’t work for my needs. They took up too much space in two different pairs of cycling shoes. No matter the adjustments, they weren’t comfy. I had high hope they would help a neuroma pain but they only yielded numb feet on both sides. Backcountry is great but the product didn’t work.
review.name: Not great

review.reviewBody: Transformed my mildly uncomfortable RX8's into very comfortable shoes. Remove some of the pain on the knees due to better arch support, especially when putting down torque on pedals. Would certainly recommend!
review.name: Fantastic insoles!

review.reviewBody: My arches need all the support they can get. These sock liners fit perfectly. They provide additional stability and support, I got a pair for both my road and gravel shoes.
review.name: These works well!

review.reviewBody: I have tried others, but the specialized bag science works well.
review.name: Use them in all my cycling shoes

review.reviewBody: Run true to size but thicker than original insoles. With my high instep these only work in my shoes with more volume/space. They are very comfortable in the shoes that fit. Haven’t done more than 30 trainer miles at once them. Total of approximately 500 miles. Would recommend for shoes with enough volume. My other shoes are too tight with these insoles.
review.name: Specialized Body Geometry SL Insoles

review.reviewBody: I bought my first pair of these footbeds in 2014 when I did a ride across America, some 3,600 miles without any problems.  I have used them ever since.  It was time for new ones, and I knew just where to turn - - Specialized Footbeds from Competitive Cyclist.
review.name: Great Footbeds

name: Body Geometry SL Footbeds

review.reviewBody: CAMP ball nuts look a bit funky but boy do they feel solid when placed. Great for uneven or jagged rocks where cam lobes just won?t set right, and where the flare just won?t take a regular or off set nut. Surprisingly each piece accommodates more of a range than expected allowing for some good variation options. Most importantly, once set they feel super solid. If you climb thin, uneven cracks or pin scarred areas regularly, these are a versatile and essential piece of gear for your rack.
review.name: Solid piece of gear

hasVariant.name: Alugator Pro Light Shovel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Alugator Pro Light Shovel online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is a great shovel because it does shovel things. When I stick it in the snow, it scoops up snow the best way any shovel can scoop. For real though, it's nice and light, compresses smaller and fits almost any bag designed for avvy stuff.
review.name: Good shovel

review.reviewBody: The shovel is everything that you need in the backcountry. It is sturdy while being very lightweight and compacts you down well.
lightweight and easy to quickly assemble, no hoe position for the handle which is kind of unfortunate but not a major drawback.
review.name: handy tool

review.reviewBody: Bought this with the intention to keep it in my truck as a part of my winter travel kit. It's a fantastic choice, lightweight and small enough to fit in the back of the truck and expands to a good size for snow removal. I haven't been able to put it on my daypack for hiking/snowshoeing but it seems like a great option to have for emergency uses in backcountry or as a part of a vehicle winter kit.
review.name: Lightweight and Great Size

review.reviewBody: alugator hoe mode is the way to go.  Way more efficient at clearing snow than the traditional shovel.
Fast assembly, durable, light for a full l length shovel.
review.name: Great shovel

review.reviewBody: Great shovel packs well and is very light would buy again. Helps with rescue and moving. Stows very easy.
review.name: Great shovel

review.reviewBody: Light weight, folds down for simple pack storage, strong shovel.  Took touring and worked great!
review.name: Great light weight shovel

review.reviewBody: Great shovel, easy to pack and carry and moves snow well.
review.name: Light and Packable

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love it. I only wish that I could flip it to make a scoop but otherwise it is great. It is lightweight, compact and is pretty sturdy.

name: Alugator Pro Light Shovel

review.reviewBody:
I always figured how much better could aftermarket pads be? Surely SRAM is doing an alright job making their own OE pads, aftermarket materials can't be that different. Well, after years of riding OE SRAM pads I finally tried these MTX pads. It is wild how much better they feel. Stronger bite and much quieter... the two things you could wish for from brake pads. My only regret is not trying them sooner. 

I'm sure everyone's experience/opinions will vary, but considering these are negligibly more expensive than the OE pads anyway you should definitely give these a try next time you need pads. Ok relatively they're 1.5x as expensive ($23 vs $35 I believe)... but $12 more for a bike part that drastically improves the performance of your bike is a no brainer. 

Have not ridden them enough to comment on longevity... will update my review if they wear out unusually fast, but I have not seen any such complaints online so I'm not worried about that.
review.name: Slept on these far too long

name: Gold Label Brake Pads

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of the Divide 5. I purchased the waterproof version for a trail race and liked them so much I decided to get a regular pair. One of the most comfortable trail shoes I have ever worn in 20+ years of running. While they are great on trails you can also run pavement and they still feel good.
Love the feel of the shoe. I use it mainly for golf and some running on road/trail.
review.name: Versatility in one shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought because of hybrid type of inning shoe but soles a little soft for road and are wearing faster then expected.  Achilles cushion has something sharp which causes blisters and flatter arch then I prefer. Would not purchase again.
review.name: Fair shoe

review.reviewBody: Like side to side support, traction, lightweight and breathable upper, roomy toe box.  Felt very stiff at first, but after 10 miles felt very good. Do not care for the color combination at all (why are all Brooks trail shoes so garish?). How about some nice solid color options like the new Adrenaline     Comments based on walking, not running.
review.name: Good performance, horrible looks

review.reviewBody: These are very comfortable once you get them broken in a bit.  I use these on trails and grass paths and while they are a little bit chunkier than I'm used to, they fit and give the cushion that I need!  My back doesn't hurt after a few miles of trail or park walking!
review.name: Perfect for trails.

review.reviewBody: Love the shoes…great fit…look forward to grabbing more pairs!
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody:
A great fit w/no break-in needed! 
Extra  stability with running on packed dirt/gravel trails!
Bravo!
review.name: A Natural Fit

review.reviewBody: Like the cushion and the grip.Don’t have as much cushion as my ghost max which is a bit too much for me but they feel kinda like my beasts which are my favorite only with alot more traction for the loose trails
review.name: Go to shoes for trails

review.reviewBody: They feel great! I love the slightly wider area in the toe area as compared to my earlier Divide model. Great support all around the foot, and the tread pattern has more individual treads along with being a bit wider. A fantastic model, now; don't change anything!
review.name: Divide 5 -- Don't Change a Thing Now!

review.reviewBody: The shoes feels great, I use them for both work mainly but looking at a second pair for working out

name: Divide 5 Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I've never used a pull over entry jacket before. It feels really comfortable and out of the way. The range of motion feels good too.
review.name: Feels very comfortable

review.reviewBody: The fit is really nice, not too bulky.  Very mobile  for trips around the sailboat. Works well on the catamaran as well
review.name: Love the fit

review.reviewBody:
I was so happy with how well the Bowen fit that I wore it around the house the day it arrived. 

Smart strap management, great storage, excellent fit, and it kept me afloat after I swam on Go Left on the Main Payette. All great features.

I'm 6'0 tall and 190 lbs. Size M/L was perfect.
review.name: I wore it around the house after it arrived

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable , well designed and light weight ...
review.name: Bowen PFD

review.reviewBody: This is a great setup, comfortable and low profile
review.name: Great Setup

review.reviewBody: LOVE IT! Had the Layla before this, definitely fits differently but I like the range of motion.
review.name: Heck ya rafting.

review.reviewBody: I've been waiting years for a lightweight yet super-high quality side-entry PFD with loads of flotation.... and finally, here it is.  This is an awesome product.  The clam shell pocket is unreal stash for anything you need handy.  I use mine primarily on long coastal SUP  expeditions, and any extra weight can add back strain with the repeated hip hinge of paddling, but I almost didn't notice I was wearing this jacket.  Very comfortable.  Usual bomb proof Astral build.  Highly recommended.
review.name: Perfect Side-Entry, Lightweight, High-Quality PFD

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, practical, affordable. Best life jacket on market for those getting into the sport!
review.name: Strongly recommend

review.reviewBody: As the owner of three pfd’s this is the favorite but all are 5 star Astral brand !
review.name: My pfd

review.reviewBody: Love this PFD, I have been waiting forever for them to make another eggplant PFD besides the layla and I bought this one the say it came out. I love the clam shell and the hand warmers.
review.name: love this eggplant beauty

hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Thru-Link Inline Filter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Used on the John Muir Trail in 2020 and will use it again in 2024. So fast and easy. Pull out water bladder from pack, open bladder, submerge in water, close, drink! While my friends were messing around with squeezing water from filter bags into water bottles, I was relaxing. More trust worthy and faster than chemical tablets. Recommend highly.
review.name: Great for backpacking

review.reviewBody:
I've been using this filter for a year now, really happy with it. I use it both as an inline-filter when attached to my dirty waterbag, as as a gravity-filter to my clean water drinking bladder that is inside my pack.
The only downside for me is its "lenght" at 19.5cm I've had difficulties finding a "small, but large enough" pouch to keep it "clean" from dirt and "not leaking into my pack" inside my backpack when not in use.
review.name: Great filter

review.reviewBody: If every ounce of weight counts this is my go to water filter system with big zip Evo bladder. Downside is not having a filtered water bag for making coffee or boiling meals. I’ll use this when I have clean glacier water to drink and not concerned about boiling my water for a long period when making coffee or freeze dried meals.
review.name: Lightweight and compact, has its place and time.

review.reviewBody: This filter works phenomenal. I've used it in clear quick running water and murky ponds. It has worked great for both. I would highly recommend it, especially for the price. I plan on buying several more in the future.
review.name: Makes life easier on the trail

review.reviewBody: Product needs a little refining but overall it does the job
review.name: Very Handy

review.reviewBody: This filter is rad. I use mine with a HydraPak hydration bladder and it makes collecting water a breeze. I've never liked to stop and filter water, and I love that I can filter as I go with this system. Officially a convert from Sawyer Squeeze :)
review.name: Filtering just got so much easier

review.reviewBody: Worked well no issues. Took me a few minutes to realize that to use this, I needed to cut my hose in half.
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: This is a great, lightweight solution to all of your water filtration needs! It's very convenient and can be used in your pack, or outside as a gravity filter.
review.name: PERFECT

review.reviewBody: Im excited about the new filter and its working well thus far!
review.name: Great new product!

review.reviewBody: Great way to reduce weight if you just use a water bladder and pour unfiltered water in to it.
review.name: Nice weight saver

name: Thru-Link Inline Filter

review.reviewBody: I am delighted with my Leki Instructor Lite trekking poles. Since I’ve started using my poles a month ago, I’ve been able to reach my goal of walking 4,000 steps every day.
review.name: Trekking Through Life

review.reviewBody: Truly lite, easy to adjust, multiple tips very handy, tough enough to handle abuse! Good purchase.
review.name: Worthwhile purchase

review.reviewBody: These are top-rated Nordic walking poles on every website I've visited, so despite the fact they were described as "trekking poles" here (they are indeed Nordic walking poles), I purchased them.  I'm not disappointed!  In my opinion they have earned every 5 star review they've received!   Although I've read about the hazards of two-piece poles collapsing, there these are well-built and exceptionally strong.  I like the option of adjustable length, especially when storing them.  The straps are very comfortable and fit well.  I'm so glad I was able to order them from Backcountry.  I live in a remote area in Montana and was pleasantly surprised to receive them in a couple of days.
review.name: NORDIC Walking Poles

review.reviewBody: I'm a 78 year old once very fit man who now has severe hearing loss with attendent balance issues and I have ostearthritis in a hip joint, knees, and hands. My Leki Nordic Walking poles enable me to walk safely. I've walked up to 5 miles without a hitch! These are awesome walking enablers!!! I highly recommend them!
review.name: Awesome Walking Poles!!!

review.reviewBody: Life-changing!  I started with less expensive poles but they were heavy and awkward. The LEKI’s are lightweight, sturdy, and ingeniously engineered.
review.name: Life-changing!

review.reviewBody: Light and fast. Should ship with extra spike booties and hand straps; one pair bigger to use with gloves.
review.name: Nordic Instructor poles

name: Instructor Lite Speedlock 2 Trekking Poles

review.reviewBody: After multiple slipper purchases and returns, a friend recommended Keen slippers. I finally have a comfortable, warm, supportive and functional pair of slippers/house shoes.
review.name: Finally- a pair of slippers that doesn’t hurt my feet!

review.reviewBody: Runs large. I take a size 9, the shoe fits like a size 10. Definitely will be wearing my wool socks.
review.name: Excellent procedure.

review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd pair, love these slippers!!! They run a little big-i normally wear a 10 womens shoe, but need these in a 9.
review.name: Great slippers!

review.reviewBody:
A great shoe for wearing around the house or in the great outdoors! Just the right amount of warmth and support, very cozy and comfortable.
With fallen arches and arthritic knees, these give me comfort on my feet for hours at a time. 
As always, the shoe slippers proved to be a winner again. Thank you, KEEN!
review.name: Best of Show!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the best slip-on shoes! Need to take puppy out to backyard in morning, and these slide on fast. Best support and warm! I bought 2!!
review.name: Best slip-ons

review.reviewBody:
Have replaced my Birkenstocks for easy access indoor and outdoor shoes. I have a small market garden and change between shoes and boots 20 times a day.
These are giving better support and stability, and still slip on and off quickly. 
Will be buying more.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody:
I had tried a KEEN slip on at the local shoe store, but the direct contact with the sole wasn't comfortable. They couldn't get my size so I looked online. Ordered the shoe in a size 11 (I normally buy 12 Narrow) and hoped for the best. Also enjoyed a good discount. 
Was so surprised at the quality and finish of this style. Also added old New Balance inserts and got a really comfortable fit with no concern about the feeling of direct contact with the sole. 
Biggest surprise was my ability to wear the shoe out and about with good tight fit. 
Will add KEEN to my brand of possible shoe choices.
review.name: Works for narrow feet!

review.reviewBody: Great comfort and great look. Love the space in tow and the fact that i it is recycled materials.
review.name: Very comfortable.

review.reviewBody: I love the Women’s Howser II. Great fit, arch support and comfort. I wear them inside and outside the house.
review.name: Best comfortable shoe

review.reviewBody: Worn these house shoes for more than 10 years. They are a necessity in our lives!
review.name: Worn these house shoes for

review.name: Super Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Looks like they will be Great Winter Boots or at least good for those really cold days where you have to go out and run some errands or just even just to take the dog out or wear at home like sleepers, haven't take them off since I came back from work and found the package at my door step, i took them out the box and wear them right away , they felt really comfortable soft and warm almost instantly! my feet was actually cold and got toasty in seconds ! Will update later on how they work walking on snow or ice, probably and hopefully really well. Over All Good Buy !

review.reviewBody: Everything I was looking for- sleek beautiful design, lightweight, comfortable straps, spacious, just the right number and configuration of pockets and zippered compartments, and a luggage sleeve so I can put it on top of my roller luggage. I had been looking for years for something like this. I hope you start to advertise it more so people can discover your product because this is travel backpack perfected.
review.name: Perfection

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I liked the shape of this case and the material it’s made of. Seems really durable and sturdy I would have liked it to be a little bigger and maybe have a strap.
review.name: Sturdy and well made.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have used this backpack twice for a trip. The backpack looks pretty cool and sleek. I was a little apprehensive because when empty, the backpack has a hard time standing up on its own but after I put my items in it, it held up pretty well. It cleans pretty easily on the outside and has enough space to fit my laptop and all my travel carryon items. Will continue to use this and recommend.
review.name: Good backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If you are having trouble keeping wires, charges, and cords organized then Thule power shuttle is a must have. It's compact but it's big enough to fit your items in but small enough to travel with. The quality is great and it feels really sturdy. So many compartments within it.
review.name: Stay organized with Thule Subterra PowerShuttle

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Thule Subterra PowerShuttle Medium has a thoughtful design ensures that everything has its place, keeping my items secure and easily accessible. The medium size strikes a perfect balance between portability and storage capacity, making it ideal for everyday use or travel.
review.name: Solid and ideal size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ready for some hiking or International traveling?  This Thule backpack has it all with the storage compartments inside. Now you can bring both your computer and tablet with peace of mind they will be protected within. You could even bring two water bottles for a hike and stay well hydrated. Sorry the kitchen sink will not fit inside but you will be surprised at all that can fit. The material is sturdy and rich feeling for texture. The price may seem steep but for how well it is made and the usefulness I would recommend it for all you adventure enthusiasts!
review.name: Thule Heavy Duty Backpack with Style

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great solid bag for electronic accessories for travel, portability and easy organizing of phone, tablet accessories. Easy storage areas, great quality and storage capacity.
review.name: Great electronic  accessories travel bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect and very large , i love how the model looks, perfect for travel, and also very comfortable. A lot of space in it. Thanks for the great design and product
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really nicely designed and see like it’s very durable. It has a lot of well thought out pockets and is small enough to fit in a backpack or luggage for travel.
review.name: Super compact

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As a frequent traveler and tech enthusiast, finding the perfect solution to organize and protect my gadgets has always been a priority. Recently, I stumbled upon the Thule Subterra PowerShuttle Medium Electronics Travel Case, and it has completely transformed the way I carry and manage my electronic essentials. Here’s why I’m raving about it:
Design and Build Quality:
First impressions matter, and the Thule Subterra PowerShuttle Medium doesn't disappoint. Crafted with durable and high-quality materials, this travel case exudes a premium feel from the moment you hold it in your hands. The sleek and compact design ensures it easily slips into any bag or backpack, making it perfect for both business trips and leisure travels.
Organization and Storage:
One of the standout features of this travel case is its intelligent organization system. With multiple elastic loops, mesh pockets, and padded compartments, it provides ample space to store all your electronic devices, cables, and accessories securely. Whether it’s your smartphone, power bank, charging cables, or earphones, everything has its designated place, eliminating the hassle of tangled wires and misplaced gadgets.
Versatility and Functionality:
What sets the Thule Subterra PowerShuttle apart is its versatility and functionality. The removable divider allows you to customize the interior layout according to your needs, accommodating larger items such as tablets or small laptops effortlessly. Additionally, the case features a convenient pass-through port for charging cables, allowing you to charge your devices without having to remove them from the case—an ingenious design for on-the-go individuals.
Durability and Protection:
When it comes to protecting my valuable electronics, I don't compromise, and neither does the Thule Subterra PowerShuttle. The rugged exterior and padded interior ensure that your devices remain safeguarded against bumps, drops, and scratches during transit. Whether you're navigating crowded airports or rough terrains, you can trust this case to keep your gadgets safe and secure at all times.
Overall, the Thule Subterra PowerShuttle Medium Electronics Travel Case is a game-changer for travelers who demand both style and functionality. Its thoughtful design, durable construction, and ample storage make it an indispensable companion for anyone who wants to keep their electronic essentials organized and protected on the go. If you're in the market for a reliable and versatile travel case, look no further—this one ticks all the boxes and then some. Highly recommended!
review.name: A Travel Essential

name: Subterra 27L Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover Fleece - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable! Arms are long enough for the thumb holes to be useful, and it’s a very nice fleece weight for casual wear. This is not a performance layer, but I will wear it for more active pursuits occasionally and it performs well. It’s also a flattering cut and nice color, I’ve gotten a lot of compliments on it. Like it so much I bought the snap neck version as well!
review.name: Comfy and flattering

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover Fleece - Women's
review.reviewBody: very disappointed. the color is pretty bit it runs really small. it's tight
review.name: runs small

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover Fleece - Women's
review.reviewBody: Typically I only purchase natural fibre clothing but I’ve bought both a winter coat and a vest from OR that I love so I decided to try this cowl top. I’m not disappointed! I love it so much that I’ve just ordered another. It fits perfectly, I love the thumb slits in the cuff, it’s very comfortable and cozy. I initially purchased the orange fizz. Looking forward to adding the galaxy blue to my wardrobe.
review.name: Comfy cozy

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover Fleece - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my second one, bought at nice discount. One is maroon, other an orange rust. My favorite winter sweater, love the pockets, that the back is longer than front and cowl neck. Washes well.
review.name: Love it!

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover Fleece - Women's
review.reviewBody: This shirt is incredibly cute and comfy!  It too hot, yet a perfect amount of warmth. Keeps my bottom warm while extending my leggings into the winter. Love it!
review.name: One of my favorites!

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover Fleece - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love everything about this - the color (yay bright colors!), the fit, the thumbholes (they're not too tight), and the hidden pocket in the kangaroo pouch for a credit card/key. The dropped hem is also nice and snug for keeping the drafts out.
review.name: Love this layer!

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover Fleece - Women's
review.reviewBody: This fits as expected.  It's cozy and warm with great pockets. The color was a bit brighter than in the picture (turquoise) but it's nice.  Love the fabric texture and weight.  Perfect for a fall day or for layering under a jacket.
review.name: cozy and comfortable fleece top

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover Fleece - Women's
review.reviewBody: The cowl neck makes this fleece nice and cozy. Sizing wise it fits well everywhere except the very bottom. It is a little more close-fitting there than I’d like, especially when compared to sizing in the rest of the fleece. It’s ok but that means I won’t reach for this all the time. I greatly prefer the trail mix pullover style to this.
review.name: Cozy but not #1

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover Fleece - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my fourth trail mix cowl pullover! I just love the comfort, warmth, and style of the item, and of course, the variety of colours means you can mix and match. Happily recommend this item to others.
review.name: I have FOUR

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover Fleece - Women's
review.reviewBody: Functional, comfortable, stylish and warm cowl pullover. I chose the orange and am happy with the color. I love the bottom hem because of the cute and flattering shape. This is my first cowl pullover but it won’t be my last!
review.name: Great pullover with large selection of colours!

name: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover Fleece - Women's

review.reviewBody: Quality product but inconsiderate packaging. The sleeping bag is stuffed into a box that is too small for its size. Be careful when you open the box because if you use anything sharp you will easily but open your sleeping bag. There is no postage on the box to state that the box should not be opened in the general “cut open” fashion. I have received many sleeping bags that are packed into a box or bag and placed into a much larger box so as to protect it upon opening. They did not have that same level of consideration when packaging. I also contacted backcountry.com and they stated that this is “my fault” since it was not damaged in shipping. Seems very inconsiderate.
review.name: Ignorant packaging

review.reviewBody: Bought this bag back in 2016 and have used it more times than I can count, but can count the number of times I got cold in this bag (once.. hammocking- the rainfly wasn't set up well). I honestly have no complaints- lightweight, good zippers, packs down well, and cozy. Paired with a good sleeping pad, I usually only sleep in shorts unless temperatures get below 20-25F. I have used a different compress sack than the one provided to get the bag a little smaller for backpacking but only for short trips because I didn't like compressing the bag too much. Around 7 years of owning this bag and I have no regrets, Western Mountaineering is a great company.
review.name: Best Bag Ever?

review.reviewBody:
I did an overnight to test it out @ 5000ft/5degreesF. Nemo Hornet/Xtherm were the sleeping arrangements. I layered some merino thermals with down pants from Amazon ($60, a must have) and a Decathlon down jacket ($100). I also had down booties. I was roasting before I knew it. This can be an all season bag IMHO. You just have to help it out a little. 
As far as comfort, it wasn't really restrictive which surprised me considering its weight. Paired with my Xtherm, I couldn't feel any cold spots all night. I highly recommend this bag to anyone wanting the best that money can buy. 
I have an upcoming trip in 2 weeks that'll be 40 miles over 3 days in the Mts. I can't wait. I'll try and post an update if necessary but I'm sold already.
review.name: Toasty AF!

review.reviewBody:
Over the years I?ve tried a few different bags at various temperature ratings and the Versalite  Western Mountaineering bag is by far my favorite!!  

One of the ultimate best features of this bag is the zipper and it?s virtually impossible to snag zipper.  Nothing worse than in the middle of the night have to fiddle with a zipper and catching on the bag, which will NEVER happen with this bag.

Draft tube collar is easy to use and well positioned, plenty of room and Wow does this thing pack down small!  When the wife and I pack up the sea kayaks for a weekend paddle trip I?m always amazed at how much smaller my bag packs compared to the ?other? brand she has and mine is a much warmer bag!  I also use my bag with a Western Mountaineering silk liner so I can keep my awesome bag as fresh and clean as possible for the longest possible time.

With the right sleeping pad I?ve had it down into the teens which I find is getting pretty close to that 10 degree rating.  I still slept just fine and was not cold but you definitely know the difference between 10 and 20 degrees.  At the 20 temp I usually just sleep with the liner, a light merino wool base layer along with a pair of regular hiking socks.  If I feel it?s going to be in the teens or colder I?ll ramp up the base layer a bit for some extra warmth.  I?m would not consider myself a cold sleeper and the wife would say I?m a regular 60,000 btu heater.

In the summer months I?ll leave it mostly unzipped and will sometimes pack a battery operated fan (I always sleep with a fan at home).  This also helps regulate my temps and even in the 30 degree temps I?ve had the fan a blowing.  

I?m 5?9? 180 with a 42? chest. I purchased the 6ft right zip.  I am more of a side sleeper and this allows me to open it up on the side I want to have my face hanging out of.  I have plenty of room in the bag to roll around but let?s be honest it?s a mummy bag you are not going to sprawl out like it?s a king size bed!!! At my height the 6 foot bag offered plenty of room to stuff a camping pillow in the bag and even put my arms above my head if I wanted to.
review.name: Best All-Around Bag I?ve Ever Had

review.reviewBody: If you?re a warm sleeper like me this can make a fantastic lightweight winter bag. Love this bag.
review.name: Yup

review.reviewBody: I bought my Versalite from the two "Gary's" at the Outdoor retailer show nearly ten years ago. Before that, I had, since the late nineteen ninety's, been using a Super Apache dry loft bag, which I loved for all my three season adventures. However, as I got older, I started wanting a little more wiggle room to help with some shoulder injuries etc. but still needed a sleeping bag that offered similar performance to my "Trusty" Super Apache. The Western Mountaineering "Gary's" suggested the Versalite--Man, what a great sleeping bag, its lighter than my apache was, its warmer and roomier, and it compresses just as small, i.e. I pack it into a 15 L compression stuff sack! And like another reviewer said, on the occasions when they got too warm they simply unzipped it and used it like a quilt which I also do. The Versalite is a very user friendly bag and mine has been, over the years, on dozens of adventures...and even though I really loved the Apache, the Versalite has added even greater comfort to my outdoor experiences...                                                                To Western Mountaineering, thanks for staying true to your vision and for making such well designed and reliable gear.
review.name: Great three season bag

review.reviewBody: I have only had the opportunity to test my Versalite at 40 degrees.  I unzipped it, turned it zipper-down  and placed the foot end of my  NeoAir XLite into the foot box of the bag and just used the bag as a loose quilt.  I was a bit too warm at times but slept comfortably.  I could find no manufacturing flaws in the bag at all.  I carry it in a 20L Sea-to-Summit compression sack.  I like the huge storage bag and will only use the smaller sack that came with it for laundering.
review.name: Comfortable and Warm

review.reviewBody: I own several Western Mountaineering bags of all temperature ratings, and I don't buy anything else because they're the best. But the Versalite is the last one I bought, and probably the last one I will buy. Because it's all that and more. It is super light true to spec, and warmer than I will ever need in three seasons. Most recently I used it several nights in the Winds above timberline. It was overkill warm for that. Stuffs super small, shell is downproof, zipper doesn't snag, roomy enough. What more can you ask, unless you need waterproof.
review.name: Perfect all-around bag

name: Versalite Sleeping Bag: 10F Down

review.reviewBody: Best goggle ever! No gap on my helmet and I have great vision. I have put it to the test with some of my hardest crashes and it has held up like brand new!

review.reviewBody: I love this goggle! It is so easy to switch the lenses out when you're on the hill and I love the look! I 100% recommend! I pair mine with the Giro Trig Helmet and it fits perfectly!!
review.name: Buy it!!!

review.reviewBody:
The Giro Contour is an awesome google! The ease of magnetic interchangeable lens is awesome. So easy, you can change them with your gloves on, or keep the same lens, pop it off, give it a quick clean and pop it back in.
Locked and ready to go. The Zeiss lens(s) are perfect for any type of light you encounter throughout your ski/snowboarding day. The way they fit with any brand helmet (Giro for sure) is sweet, no gaper gap, and no ice cream headaches or extra airflow to make your eyes water with these. Love them!
review.name: Sweet google!

description: Buy the Salomon QST Blank Ski - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: QST Blank Ski - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon QST Blank Ski - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Whether it's windpack, chunder or a blower pow day, the BLANKs charge through with ease. There's stuff on either end of this spectrum, but these do it all. With a smile
review.name: ABSOLUTE SLAYER

review.reviewBody:
This ski is phenomenal. It is super damp and planted. The cork damplifier really works. The ski floats better than a typical 112 and having the versatility to rip some carves on groomers on the way back to the lift is pretty sweet. Absolutely love the weight of the ski. At 2220 grams (186 length) it can really plow through chop with ease.

My one complaint is that the top sheet durability is not good. Many many companies have switched to textured nylon top sheets for a reason. If Salomon does this, I couldn’t imagine a better ski. It’s just tough to spend so much money on the ski and not have the top sheet be super durable (mainly the tips).

Overall a killer ski.
review.name: Great ski - easily damaged topsheet

review.reviewBody: The Blank is the hardest charging lightweight ski I’ve ever skied. You can lean on the tail when you need it and it doesn’t have a speed limit in anything you’d consider soft snow. It skies like it weighs 1.5x as much as it does.
review.name: The best of both worlds

review.reviewBody: Received the blanks right before two days and 23” storm, what a treat floating along, quick in the trees. Effortless cruising!
review.name: Easy turner!

review.reviewBody: The ski was great from sunrise to Sunset. But the ability to be tipped over and carved hard on groomed runs to warm up. Then floating through deep and sometimes wind crusted powder with confidence.  Every time I took off and landed from any hit, I felt rocksolid. One of the best parts was how well it charged through the crud midday and popped when ollied off every side hit. Definitely could be a quiver killer If you had mostly great snow. But if you’re going to ski the front side a lot, you’d wanna add in a narrower ski.
review.name: They Stomp!

review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace my old powder boards and could not be happier. The ski has good float in deep powder conditions but also has significant edge hold on hard pack. The side cut makes it a pretty quick turner. I just put it through the wringer at Alta where we received 30+ inches over 4 days.
review.name: Versatile Powder Ski

review.reviewBody:
Ripped in the trees and handled the increasing density snow on the way to the helicopter pick up
We caught a resort day at Sun Peaks on the way and cruised goomers all day with ease. I’m not sure how they did it but its a winner in everything I skied in.
review.name: Rocked my Heli Ski trip at Mike Wiegeles this week

review.reviewBody: I have not got to ride them yet (not quite ski season) but I have got a lot of compliments on the skis. So excited to get them out and see how they ride.
review.name: Great looking ski and the base awesome

review.reviewBody: Its so good. i use it like a week and i only can recomend it
review.name: Everything

name: QST Blank Ski - 2025

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: I bought my daughter a pair of waterproof Merrell hiking boots for a trip to Iceland and they did not disappoint! They kept her feet warm and dry, they kept grip on slippery surfaces and they were comfortable. I will definitely buy Merrill boots again in the future.
review.name: Great waterproof hiking boots

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: The hooks are in the wrong place at a wrong angle and the tongue is too short just like other customers have said. My daughter also tripped twice because of it, just like others described. My husband decided to pull the hooks out to eliminate the hazard. Merrell, you can’t charge people this much money for poorly designed shoes. You should give everyone a refund.
review.name: Shoes have major flaws - Merrell please redesign

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: Bought for my granddaughter to hike with. Broke them in in Alaska for a week and they are great! Comfortable, feet were dry and nice looking.
review.name: Great kids hiking boots

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: These are some of the most poorly constructed shoes I have ever purchased. The tongue is not long enough, so when you tie them all the way up, the top of the tongue is below the ties, and the ties dig into the ankle. So I tied them below the hooks, where they would hit the tongue, but the hooks stuck out so much that they would grab the ties of the other shoe and my son was constantly tripping! How could Merrell manage to make such a disaster of a hiking boot after all these years?? I’m hoping I can still return them.
review.name: DON’T DO IT

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: Got these for my 7 yr old who has flat feet.  Finding kids boots for flat feet is hard.  These work.
review.name: Great for flat feet.

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: Comfortable beyond belief… took them with me to Greenland & Canada.
review.name: Great hiking shoe

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: I am very happy with my hiking shoes. Nice style and very light.
review.name: Happy with my new shoes

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: There ok but there deff not waterproof bc i was waking in the rain&my feel got soaked
review.name: Not waterproof
comment: We'd love the opportunity to help at 800-288-3124.

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody:
The issue people are having with the laces behind the tongue is easily remedied by wrapping the string over the top of the hook, rather than the bottom of the hook, then crossing to tie the shoes. My son has worn this style for the past 2 years. He has done everything in them! They've held up great. Only need to be replaced because he's outgrown them. 
Tying the laces like this actually makes the shoe fit better. Some runners even do this to running shoes with lace holes. Skip the hole below the top hole, go through the top hole, then back through the hole you skipped, then tie the laces.
review.name: The laces are NOT a problem 👍

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: I bought 2 pairs for my kids and they can't wear them due to a flawed design that I see others complain about. A complete disappointment
review.name: Very disappointed
comment: We appreciate your feedback and would like to help in any way we can. Please give our team a call at 800.288.3124. Thank you.

name: Moab 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'

review.reviewBody:
No matter how I adjust this, it's not meant to be a shoulder sling/crossbody type bag - which is why I had purchased it. In fact when it arrived, the tag says it's a lumbar pack!! It can be used comfortably as a hip pack - I'm only giving 3 stars because it's not terrible if you use it as a hip pack, but I bought this because I wanted its shoulder bag functionality. I don't see how this would make sense as a lumbar pack, but that's what the actual brand tag says it is. Hip pack worn on the side makes the most sense. It's not as spacious as I had hoped.

Overall decent materials but I'm not thrilled because I thought this would be more functional than what it is. Wearing it on your hip does decrease the volume because you are introducing a curve.

FWIW I'm very very petite with a short torso. I'm 4'10" so if anyone could have made this work as a shoulder/crossbody sling, it would have been me. There's not nearly enough length on the straps to convert it to the advertised use.
review.name: NOT a shoulder sling!!

name: Knockabout 4L Sling Bag

review.reviewBody: I'm in the process of changing my clothes over to natural fiber so these caught my eye since they're cotton (60%). I wear them all the time! They're thick shorts- sweatpants material. Great for running errands, lounging around, or to throw on after the pool or a workout. The pockets on the side are very functional. I would consider buying another pair in a different color! I ordered a size medium. Seems to run slightly on the large size but I like the baggy fit. And the price point was another bonus!
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: Bought all three colors. Very comfortable. Made well. Impressed.
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody: The shorts are a lovely color and the ribbon detail on the side pockets is cute. However, the experience I've had with the odd cut of Stoic brand bottoms continues with these. I sized up, so they fit fine, but there is something off about the length of the crotch or the amount of fabric for your bottom. This is the third Stoic brand bottom I've bought and every one of them have had this weird cut. I have a very straight build with almost no hips to speak of, a small booty, and fairly average athletic thighs. I can't imagine these shorts would work for someone with any curves to speak of. I hate it because there are some cute Stoic brand styles, but I have no idea what body they make their clothes for.
review.name: Cute but weird sizing

description: Buy the Thule Nanum 18L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Nanum 18L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Nanum 18L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought Nanum to wear during the upcoming ski season. On a whim I used it as my personal item on a flight for an overnight trip. I could not believe how much I was able to pack in and still remain a comfortable carry! I own a larger 20L Thule backpack that I was very happy with. The Nanum  was smaller and lighter but still allowed for many items. The rigid back frame kept the bag off my back and allowed for air to circulate. The smaller top pocket had just enough spaces to organize smaller items but didn't waste space with mutiple, limited functionality pockets found on larger packs. A bonus was the removable waiststrap. Thanks Thule!
review.name: Great Minimalist pack

name: Nanum 18L Backpack

Need I say more...

ARMADA OR NADA
review.name: The ULTIMATE All-Mountain Destroyer!

hasVariant.name: Trailbreaker II Pant - Men's

hasVariant.name: Trailbreaker II Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Trailbreaker II Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: i chose these as my new soft-shell pants for ski touring, and have been incredibly pleased. temperature regulation with these is great - the vent zips down the side offer nice cooling for the skin up, but the pants can still keep the all warmth in when you need it for the colder days. lots of well placed pockets as well. comfortable, water beading, lots of mobility - overall super stoked with these!
review.name: the perfect touring pants.

review.reviewBody: These trousers are comfortable, light and so breathable. The side zips are perfect for ventilation when snowshoeing. They feel well built and good quality.
review.name: Great for winter activities

review.reviewBody: I'm 230lbs and 6'5 and these pants in size XL fit perfect. So far I went touring with them only once, and they performed without any issues. Breathability was excellent. It feels like they might work well enough for resort skiing too, but that's something I've yet to verify.
review.name: solid and look good

review.reviewBody: Perfect for what I wanted them for. Seem very waterproof and very durable. Would definitely recommend.
review.name: Great Snow Pants

review.reviewBody: Love the velcro waist adjustment. Thigh vents are perfect to dump heat. And don't have to wear gaiters in all situations anymore with reenforced ankles.
review.name: Readily adjustable

review.reviewBody: Built for the outdoors ! The materials and the stitching never fails ! OR for life
review.name: OR tried and true

review.reviewBody: Used for long day outdoors during search and rescue dog training. Very comfortable, easy to vent while clambering around. Rugged without looking or feeling too stiff or hard. Fits a bit snug.
review.name: They're durable and activity specific

review.reviewBody: I bought these for walking in wet weather. I know water resistant doesn't mean water proof but the first time wore these in a light rain my thighs were soaked through in scout 10-15 minutes. The upper material, while comfortable and stretchy, can hardly be considered water resistant. If I wore these in a heavy downpour I might as well just dump my entire water bottle down my pants and save some time.
review.name: "water resistant"

review.reviewBody: Great touring pant for snowboard boot fit. Might be a little tight getting the cuff over ski boots. At 6'0'' 175 lbs with a waist of 33" I hover between medium and large fits often. The large worked perfectly. the adjustable waist band with velcro fasteners are great. They are lightweight yet durable. The right amount of stretch, and the hip/outer thigh vents are great.
review.name: Great touring pant for snowbaorders

review.reviewBody: Size medium fits nicely for me - I usually wear 32/32 pants. The elastic adjustable waistband is a nice touch but I also ordered suspenders to keep them up while active. Looking forward to trying these out this winter season hiking and snowshoeing.
review.name: Excited to try these out this season

name: Trailbreaker II Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I just switched from the Fox Speedframe Pro into this helmet and it is WAY more comfortable for me.  I used to get a major pressure point on my forehead with the Fox, but this Lazer helmet fits so well and really like the adjustment system .

I do wish that there was one more vent on top, but overall i get good air flow vs other helmets I have had in the past.
review.name: Very comfy!

review.reviewBody: It does seem light but you definitely need a rounder head profile! It does feel like it sits on the top of your head like a top hat rather the on your head like a baseball hat if that makes sense. But that could be because it didn't fit quite right
review.name: Need round head

review.reviewBody:
I was very intrigued by the idea of Kineticore when I first learned about it. Everything about it makes sense to me. Rotational impact protection without the snaggy, sweaty, ventilation reducing yellow liner.
-Instead of the added protection limiting ventilation, it increases it. I live in TX and airy helmets are important down here. This lid breathes well despite the amount of coverage that it has.
-Instead of the added protection adding weight, it reduces it. Foam is removed from the normal shape of the helmet in key areas that allow the "crumple zones" to be effective while still keeping the structural strength of the helmet. This helmet feels solid in the hands but doesn't feel weighty at all while wearing it. I wouldn't go as far as saying it's an ultralight helmet, but pretty good for an enduro-style lid.
I really like all the features.
-The visor's 3 positions all work great and stay put, but I normally have it in the middle spot.
-The fidlock buckle is a great thing I wish all my other helmets had!
-The rubber pad for the goggle strap is nice and wide for plenty of grip.
-The included light/camera mount is SUPER solid when mounted. I do night riding in the winter and it's really important that my light with its built-in, heavier battery stays put and doesn't jiggle.
My only complaints...I love the look of the helmet, but it does have a bit of that mushroom look. I'm totally willing to overlook that though because the rest of the helmet makes up for it. Also, while I got the grey one, I really wish that there was a white one. Dark helmets are hotter.
review.name: Cool tech, very comfortable!

review.reviewBody:
After picking up the G1 a few months ago, I was excited to try the Jackal Kineticore, and it did not disappoint. Similar to the G1, the Jackal is lightweight and vents well. I'm a pretty sweaty rider, and so far no issues with sweat in my eyes or overheating. The rear fit system comes down lower than in most other Lazer helmets so it's not quite as ponytail friendly, but still beats out most other options on the market. 

The Jackal is pretty dialed for riding with goggles, as the visor is highly adjustable and you can store them on the helmet when not in use. This will come in handy later this summer when the Utah moondust returns. 

The one flaw that I've found is a lack of glasses storage on the helmet. Not a huge deal once goggle season begins.
review.name: Lightweight and Comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Lazer does a great job with their road helmets but is relatively new to the mtb world so the Jackal surprised me with how good it feels. I'm coming from a Smith Forefront 2 which fits great and went with the same size. If anything the Jackal fits even better - there's plenty of adjustability and it's works well with my fairly average head shape. It didn't bounce around on rough trails and I forgot I was wearing it which is the best thing you can say about a helmet.

The magnetic buckle is a small thing but I love it - snapping it closed one handed while pedaling no longer takes any focus. The Kineticore pads are unobtrusive so better than MIPS - I don't thinkg to hard about safety systems when buying helmets but this one is supposed to be pretty good. The visor is adjustable and is shaped nicely, deflecting plenty of brush on an overgrown trail. I was excited to see a light mount included but it's unimpressive - it velcros rather than clips on and blocks one of the vents. It takes Gopro style mounts.

The shape provides similar coverage to the Forefront but has a rounder look which I don't care for. That's my main negative point on the Jackal, but it may look better on you. Color options are top notch! I didn't weight this but it felt as light or lighter than any similar helmet I've tried.
review.name: Impressive Design

review.reviewBody:
I think I just found my new I'm not going to ride like a totally idiot helmet!  I have three helmets that I use for riding: A full face down hill helmet, a detachable chin bar DH certified and now this Jackal.  When I have to pedal up and ride the dumb stuff I grab a full face, but for the average I'm going riding with the dog, or hit the flow trail or a quick spin before work I like a half shell.  
One of the main things I love about this helmet is the visor.  I know right something that really has nothing to do with safety or fit but just a simple visor.  What is so great about the visor is more so how the helmet fits.  We've all been out on that late evening or early morning ride where the sun is simply shining right into your eyes and you are riding down the trail with your head cocked to the side trying to block out the sun.  Well the way this helmet fits it's actually the first helmet I have ever had that I feel offers adequate sun protection while riding at these times of the day.  I was out just yesterday for one of those here comes the sun rides and was super stoked about how well the visor performed.
We all have a slightly different shaped head and I have found Lazer, Bell and Giro to be the most comfortable for me.  The position of the rear retention strap on the back of the helmet can be adjusted up or down to suit your needs, this is a key element for me.  If the retention strap sits to low it will give me a slight headache on longer rides.  
I haven't tested out the Kineticore in a crash yet so no words on how this will perform in a crash, but based on past experience with Lazer helmets I'll be just fine.
Last thing to note that is usually overlooked on helmets is the chin strap.  I love helmets that utilized the fidlock buckler.  It's so much easer to work when you have gloves on and I've never ever had one open up on me or break.
I should also mention one last thing that I prefer over a Kineticore helmet vs a standard MIPS is that if you have longer fine hair it will not get caught in little yellow knobs that you find in MIPS type helmets.  Not a problem for me but something my wife has mentioned to me about some of her previous MIPS helmets.

In the box::  Helmet, helmet bag, light / camera mount, and some little what look like sticky pads (super thin probably not a pad)
As for sizing, I looked at the size chart, measured my noggin and ordered per chart.  Fit is spot on so true to size.  Which is also the same size I have in my other Lazer road helmet, my DH helmet and my other MTB helmet.
I did not have the previous jackal helmet but did try one on and I believe this fits much better and runs larger than the MIPS Jackal version which I feel runs a bit small.
review.name: The Visor i've dreamed of.

review.reviewBody: No surprise that Lazer has come out with another awesome helmet design and this one in particular is pretty cool because it features the Kineticore tech.  It's reasonably lightweight for how much protection it offers and the magnetic straps make it a breeze to take on and off even with gloves.  I will say it is significantly bigger than my TLD A1 helmet but that's mainly due to the added protection of the helmet as a whole.  The fit gauge in the back is great for a dialed feel and for me, personally, this fit true to size.  I'm a L in helmets across the board and this one was no different. Overall, I've been able to ride this over the course of a couple rides and have no complaints at all, if you're looking for a helmet that has great protection but don't want to sacrifice breathability and weight I would highly suggest checking out the Jackal.
review.name: Comfort without sacrificing protection

review.reviewBody:
So comfortable! I have no hair which can be an issue when it comes to a comfortable helmet, but after my first couple rides in this Lazer Helmet I didn't want to take it off. I even caught myself getting ready to back out of the parking lot with it on. Plus the magnetic strap means no more taking off the gloves to find the clips, that is if you decide to ever take the helmet off. 
Don't forget about the built in GoPro mount, so you don't ever have to worry about forgetting the GoPro mount at home.
review.name: No hair? Don't care, still comfortable!

review.reviewBody:
Loaded with safety, I am excited to see the massive focus change in cycling helmets from "light and aero" to "SAFER" with added focus on protection from low-speed impacts and rotational forces.
This helmet is mega comfy.  I tried on the old Jackal MIPS and while it was alright, I felt like I had to size up to get the fit I wanted.  I am a Medium in POC, FOX (Speedframe only), SMITH, TLD, Bell, Giro, Specialized, and in this new Jackal Kineticore, the Medium fits me perfectly.  It has a fit that is slightly more Oval, so if you like POC, GIRO, or Specialized, you will love the fit of the Jackal.  I feel like it offers superior coverage, dropping down on the sides and back more.  The retention system has a very positive feel, the pads are comfy, and I LOVE the FidLock buckle which makes it super easy to buckle the helmet 1 handed when you realize 100 yards into the trail that you forgot to buckle it.  I wish every helmet had that buckle.
review.name: Dialed Fit and Comfort

review.reviewBody: This helmet is pretty sick! By far my favorite feature is the Fidlock strap closure system. It's magnetic and easily snaps into place, and then when you need to take it off all you have to do is kind of turn it and it comes undone, super easy even with gloves. It vents well and I never got hot. The adjustment system in the back is pretty cool and gives a very nice fit. Super happy with this helmet, makes it hard to ride with another helmet when you could be wearing this.
review.name: Sweet Helmet

name: Jackal Kineticore Helmet
