description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Wingman Multi Pocket online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Wingman Multi Pocket
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Wingman Multi Pocket online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Wingman Multi Pocket
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Wingman Multi Pocket online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Cool concept.  Needs to be just a tad bigger.  I added a loop (Velcro) field inside to accommodate a hook backed holster.  Would be cool of this were thought out, from a CCW perspective, ie: draw angle. Some things are nice to have while hiking.
review.name: If it was just a tad bigger

review.reviewBody:
Great for short hikes or around town and sightseeing.  Handy having water with you and this man's it easy
  Also Great for a couple hours cross country ski. I use it more waist or over shoulder.
review.name: Great for short hikes

review.reviewBody:
This is a great product IF your priority is not the water bottle.
The main pocket is a tremendous improvement over the older model. Three compartments make it really easy to stash wallet, phone, keys, and snacks w/o losing anything or having to shuffle around for it.
The entire item is easier to clip into any pack set up and the updated approach lets you rock this as a standalone pocket.
UNFORTUNATELY, the water bottle pocket is a problem. the opening fits a 32 oz Nalgene, but the retention method is a joke. That 3mm bungie cord is not enough to secure the bottle, especially since it'll flop around as is. It's a huge mistake considering the elastic opening on MR's own Bottle Pocket and SOCOM Water Bottle Pocket are perfect. I'm going to mod this with 3mm rivets around the opening to create a drawstring that will better secure the bottle.
review.name: Great pocket, water bottle is an afterthought.

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to like this additional pocket.  I bought it to mount on my baby carrier backpack and hunting pack.  It is not a universal fit, so it does not really fit the baby carrier well. which doesn't make for a convenient carry for my water bottle. I don't use it for long walks but do use it for short walks as a beer holder.  As for my hunting pack (which is a Mystery Ranch) if fits well but still is a little clunky. I'm still going to use it and hope to get use to it.
review.name: Great concept, odd design

review.reviewBody: Very minimal no frills. Holds my water, phone, sunglasses and a mid layer if I roll it up tight
review.name: I like it

review.reviewBody: Excellent product!  Great to use alone or mounted on your pack.  Have used it multiple times and had no issues.  Highly recommended.
review.name: Very versatile!

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this in July, 2023 after it had been out of stock for awhile. I used it recently on my trip to Waterton Lakes/Glacier National Park. The Wingman worked really well as a shoulder bag when I just needed to carry some small items and some water. I did use it with a 20 oz water bottle instead of a 32 oz Nalgene and the water bottle strap held it in the pocket very securely. 
I found the Wingman to be very well made just like all Mystery Ranch equipment. I look forward to using it with my pack!
review.name: Great accessory!

review.reviewBody: I really like the Wingman Multi-Pocket as it's very versatile with the ability to be attached to my backpack or wear/carry by itself.  It also has enough room for me to carry my water bottle, cell phone, wallet, etc... on my mornings walks/hike...
review.name: Very nice Multi Pocket addition...

review.reviewBody: Great design on this lightweight, modular add-on for packs or as a standalone fanny or chest pack.  The main zippered compartment will handle only a micro compact and one spare reload. The front and back gutter pockets will handle a phone or wallet.  The bottle sleeve will handle up to a 32 ounce Nalgene/ Hydroflask (or similar brands) bottle and can be shock corded in.  The pack is well made with quality lightweight, durable materials and craftsmanship. The pack can be easily attached between your shoulder straps on a backpack or carried solo as a fanny or chest pack.  The only shortcomings are the narrow belt when worn solo, reducing stability with weight in the pockets and bottle sleeve, and slightly increasing the size of the attachment hardware to accommodate other brands of packs more easily.
review.name: Great Modular Add On

review.reviewBody:
I bought this to use with my UA21.  I have to admit it works, so far. But, I did have to remove my sternum straps, and this does not provide the level of stability that those did.  It wouldn't be advisable to overload this with a big water bottle, AND a phone, AND anything larger than a Field Notes and pen.  It is handy.  Although, now that I look at myself in the mirror with my pack on, it looks kind of goofy.  So it goes...
I will be able to move this from pack to pack, which is a big plus, since many of the MR packs I own have no provisions for water bottles, aside from just tossing them inside the pack with all of the other stuff.  
This seems to be well made, good material, and up to Mystery Ranch standards.  But I have many more miles to travel, to see if it holds up.
review.name: Functional

name: Wingman Multi Pocket

description: Buy the Blackburn Countdown 1600 Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Countdown 1600 Headlight
hasVariant.description: Buy the Blackburn Countdown 1600 Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I *SO* wanted to love this light.  In fact, I did love it while it worked.  The functionality is great: super bright light, lots of modes for various lighting purposes and the countdown on battery time remaining is a really handy feature.  The problem is, I've had 3 (yes 3) of these break over the course of about 2.5 years.  Not sure what the problem is.  I live in a dry climate and don't ride when it does rain or snow.  I do change modes and turn the light off and on a lot while riding, but I can't see why that should be a problem.  But 3 times now, I've had this light just go dead in the middle of rides.  I would go to turn it on and nothing would happen; would just see a dim blue light from beneath/behind the controls, but the light itself would no longer work.  Seemed like something was frozen, but even letting the battery discharge completely and then doing a full recharge never fixed the issue; light was just DEAD.  Blackburn customer service was awesome: they sent two different replacements.  But since the last one they sent only lasted a few months, I'm afraid it's time to call it quits.  Can't adequately explain how much I HATE to say this next part but I guess it's time to give one of those lights from China a try.  Again, I REALLY wanted to love this Blackburn light - and I did as long as it/they worked.
review.name: GREAT functionality but hasn't lasted

name: Countdown 1600 Headlight

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Mine made it a little past 2 years and 100 miles before the waterproof membrane in one boot failed.  It's a shame, I absolutely loved them.
review.name: Didn't last very long

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Let me start by saying I have purchased many pairs of Moab’s in the past with no issues. The speed solo IS NOT waterproof. I work in an office and wore these on a day after a hard rain. Well I stepped in one puddle ( not deep and did not splash inside the boot) and the inside of my boots were wet. Maybe these would be good for hiking in Arizona, but nowhere that is a bit wet. At least they look cool.
review.name: Not as advertised
comment: Hi! We're sorry to hear of your experience and would like to do all we can to help. Please give the team a call at 800.288.3124 or live chat at Merrell.com. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Granted it has only been a few weeks, but so far comfort is great and they do seem to be waterproof. I have been wearing them in the snow and rain and my socks have stayed dry. 
I did follow the recommendation I saw to order a half size larger and that was good as it is a perfect fit.
review.name: Loving my shoes

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This pair of Merrill's is my second of this type: moderate hiking, lightweight, durable, comfortable, and waterproof.  These are all qualities I find very desirable for the type of walking I do.  I am not an avid trail hiker and do most of my walking in my residential neighborhood in Portland, Oregon.  My walks are frequent, usually 2 miles, covering varied terrain (sidewalks, park fields, and city pathways) and routes.  I am more the flaneur than the inveterate hiker.  My Merrill’s are very supportive and comfortable, and their being waterproof is a particularly appreciated quality for Portland’s rainy late falls and winters.  Wet grass…no problem!  To boot (no pun intended here) they are also attractively designed.
review.name: Made For My Walks
comment: Thank you for sharing your review with us!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable and fun with one issue. I noticed after wearing them ONCE, that the right shoe makes a popping sound with every step. I can feel material in the shoe flexing and popping under the toes on my right foot with each step. I would give the review 5/5 if it weren’t for what seems like a manufacturing flaw on one shoe.
review.name: Comfortable shoes. One shoe has an issue.

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I own a bunch a Merrells, they hold up well and are light and comfortable. I liked the way these looked. they are a little different from previous Merrill high-tops I've owned. they are super light and VERY comfortable. so far i am impressed. I sell land for a living and am in the office one minute then in the woods the next. My shoes and boots are important. These are a win:)
review.name: Love'em!
comment: We're happy you love them! Thanks for sharing!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable and very lightweight.  Have hiked numerous times over varied terrain.  Best hikng boots I have ever had.
review.name: Very comfortable and lightweight

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I haven’t owned more comfortable hiking shoes as these. They are my absolute favorite pair and they look amazing. I get at least one compliment every time I wear them.
review.name: My favorite hiking shoes

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I work in the agriculture industry and walk a lot of fields every day. So far I’ve been really impressed with the all-day comfort of these boots. They don’t make my feet sweaty even though the are waterproof. I can’t take it easy on them walking through muddy corn fields every day and they do just fine. Hopefully they last as long as my last pair of Merrells!
review.name: Great boots for the hiking trail or corn field!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: We originally bought these because I needed new hiking boots, but so far I’ve worn them to work as a mail carrier and on our vacation to Washington DC and to NYC, where we walked the entire trip. They have good support and cushion, which helps with the shock on knees and lower back. I inadvertently checked out the waterproofness of the boot, by accidentally stepping in a puddle and submerging it and my foot stayed dry.
review.name: Great boot, not just for hiking!
comment: Thank you for your excellent review!

name: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's

hasVariant.name: Riva Mid RP Hiking Boot - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Teva Riva Mid RP Hiking Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Riva Mid RP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: From the first test hike about 5 miles instant comfort felt like a broken shoe. Great support without any pinched to the ankles . Will be interested in seeing how they track over the next year.
review.name: I would highly recommend it's comfortableness and support

review.itemreviewed: Riva Mid RP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had a pair of Riva's about 15 years ago and loved them, I wore them out after about 5 years of hiking and travel, and ever since I've been trying to find another good pair but none have been as good as the old ones. I ordered both Rivas and Ridgeviews and the Rivas seemed like the best for trails and hiking, Ridgeview seemed like more of a city/street boot. I'm going to keep the Riva's and return the Ridgeviews. But I might keep looking, I think there are better boots in the same price range... Which is too bad because I loved my old Riva's... A very annoying thing about both these boots is that have all eyelets for lacing up, NO HOOKS, and it makes putting them on and taking them off unnecessarily difficult. Seems like a very poor design choice.
review.name: They're ok.

review.itemreviewed: Riva Mid RP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Boots were made great, but 5 stars is for the customer service. I will try another boot from Teva.
review.name: Awesome boots, just not my fit.

review.itemreviewed: Riva Mid RP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: When I purchased these boots about a year ago, I was extemely pleased with their comfort and design. I kept them in my car to throw on whenever I went out for a hike. Unfortunatley, the changes in temperature shrunk them to a point where I can barely squeeze my feet in. When I do get them on, I end up with huge heel blisters within an hour of wearing them. I've tried putting them in front of heaters and stuffing them with tennis balls to expand them but have had no luck. Would suggest ordering a half size up if you live somewhere with cold winters!
review.name: Shrunk with Time

review.itemreviewed: Riva Mid RP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: So far they have survived a rather tough work environment! The toe box could be wider, but still comfortable. I will recommend these.
review.name: great product!

review.itemreviewed: Riva Mid RP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I work in Gatlinburg Tennessee and North Carolina as a trail guide these are used daily and are very comfortable would prefer a better water protection but I would buy again
review.name: Very well built I would buy again

review.itemreviewed: Riva Mid RP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use it almost every night walking my hunting dogs through the woods and meadow near my house. Excellent ankle support and traction
review.name: Great Hiking Boots

review.itemreviewed: Riva Mid RP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I work at a nursery and needed waterproof work boots that didn't have a safety toe, were comfortable and would last. These are exactly that.
review.name: Amazing work boots!

review.itemreviewed: Riva Mid RP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: short hikes, wore all the time on our small boat alaska trip! should probably buy another pair cause i have a hard time with 'shoes'. LOVE them!!!! would love to have in blue;-)
review.name: OMG! could wear the all the time!

review.itemreviewed: Riva Mid RP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots are made for walking! This is actually my second pair. The first pair withstood Gale force wind driven rain, Pacific Ocean salt water, snow, ice, and mud without a single leak! Please never stop selling this boot!!!!
review.name: I would but this boot again and again and again...

name: Riva Mid RP Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Channel selector on this unit will twist if you fall and change channels.  Had to duct tape it down for safety. Newer model fixes this problem.
review.name: Exposed controls

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this radio for years. It works great in snow, cold temps, and dirt and mud. Took a crash and broke the microphone  attachment, BCA warrantied it with no problem. I’ve heard the 2.0 is better, but I can’t justify buying it after having no problems with this radio. I am impressed with the range, and the battery life always lasts me all day on a fresh charge
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: I bought two at the same time.   I ride areas with a lot of trees and there is poor reception.  1/4 mile is pushing it.  One of the radios functions worse than the other.  I can hear people talking to me, but they cannot hear my response and then the radio cuts out.  The clip doesn't stay attached to my shoulder strap and the mic flaps around.
review.name: Poor Range Poor Battery life- looks cool

review.reviewBody: These have great functionality and battery life is unbelievable, but range is absolutely terrible. The bang for buck is not quite there even at a discounted price. If you are in close range, great, but anything outside of half mile or less, terrible. Would not buy these again.
review.name: Cool but

review.reviewBody: I bought three of these and Motosports really hooked me up.  Buy this radio and buy it from them!!!
review.name: Awesome radio and awesome company!!!!

review.reviewBody: These radios are so user friendly. Easy to set up, charge and put together. Great for traveling in the backcountry. The first time I used the radios was for filming and I was impressed with the range and clarity. These can change a backcountry mission and make adventures in the wild safer and more reliable!
review.name: AWESOME RADIOS

review.reviewBody: Bought this unit even though there's a newer model available. We used it while snowmobiling in the backcountry. It worked great. Saved a little cash too.
review.name: Works Great

review.reviewBody: This review is for the new 2021 1X remote. I recently change to 2021 Fox Transfer, coming up form the older version with the original fox remote. The original wasn't too bad, but over time it started to develop a play , so I start looking for options. I did try Race Face Turbine R, since it was available at the LBS, but I wasn't too impressed by it. Even thought had oversized lever (too large for my teste) it required quite an effort to engage the post, with low sensitivity. Also, it sat too high when mounted with Shimano ISPEC II mount and it was quite uncomfortable to press, so I reverted to my old remote and kept looking. Considered PNW, and Wolf tooth, but when I saw this one I decided to give it a try, considering it's for Fox post. Glad I did, works great and it's extremely smooth, and requires minimum effort to engage the post, as well as great control on how much/how fast you want to drop. Mounting it with ISPEC II it's easy (bracket not included) and it's at the right level/hight for comfortable reach. The lever comes with 22mm clamp, SRAM MM hardware, as well as cable and housing, which is not bad deal for $65.
review.name: Smooth action, works great

review.reviewBody: I've been using Fox Transfer seat posts for a while and have had just about each iteration of them.  At first, I tried out the original Fox remote and I found it severely lacking compared to Wolftooth remotes which I eventually switched back to (and I've used the Wolftooth remotes on other droppers as well).  Since Fox came out with this update, I figured I'd give it a try on my new bike build.  So far, I've been very impressed and since I'm a fan of combining clamps with the brakes, I'm glad to see Fox provide this in a Matchmaker-compatible format to go with my Code RSC brakes.  The action feels very light and placement options allowed me to dial in the distance from the grip to where I want it.  I did end up using the SRAM-provided default MMX hardware which I think just looked a bit better.  One thing to be careful of is that the bolt. that tightens against the cable protruded too deeply into the remote body.  I couldn't figure out immediately why the remote wouldn't move until I pressed a bit harder and heard the bolt scrape the body.  I'm not sure if I missed a washer somewhere in the packaging but I ended up taking a small M4 washer and using it to prevent the bolt from threading in so deep.
review.name: Great Light-Action Remote

description: Buy the Santa Cruz Bicycles Parallel Tech T-Shirt - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Parallel Tech T-Shirt - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Santa Cruz Bicycles Parallel Tech T-Shirt - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Like another reviewer from last year, I got the long sleeve edition also. That being said, I love it (only having worn it twice). Airy, comfortable, and a nice, light fit. I'm rather particular about long sleeves, and stuff irritating my inner elbow, but this is not going to be a problem for this shirt. I've got to get up onto the trails to really try it out, but I expect it will work well. My only concern is potential wear and tear, as it is a light weight fabric. We'll see how it goes. At this price, it will be worth it if I can get a single season out of it.
review.name: Wrong Item, but love it anyways

review.reviewBody: I ordered the size small in green print. Love the material, it did come in a long sleeve apposed to the described short sleeve. And the sleeves are abnormally long. So I did have to sew this jersey in. Other than that for the price you cannot beat it.
review.name: Nice material

review.reviewBody: Stylish, comfortable jersey. This is super breathable and I love the fit. Matches my Santa Cruz bike even! Plus it's a great price too.
review.name: I want another

review.reviewBody: At 5' 11", 160 lbs this fits me just like any of my other favorite medium sized t-shirts. I tend to run on the hot side and this jersey keeps me feeling cool and not looking so bad either. The polyester fabric wicks moisture really well and doesn't leave me smelling all too bad at the end of a long day of riding. Not to mention it pairs nicely with my Santa Cruz Nomad. I purchased the rust (orange) color and loved it so much I just grabbed the olive color as well!
review.name: Just grabbed another!

name: Parallel Tech T-Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Overall a good bag but check the stitching when you get it.  Had the right shoulder strap stitching pull out at the bottom buckle while traveling.  Had to get out the needle and  thread and hand repair.  

Other than that quality issue, the rest has been good.  Love the locking zippers, the side zipper for the laptop/ipad is excellent and there are lots of handles to grab the bag (top, front and side for the laptop zipper).
review.name: Check stitching

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my adult daughter. She has a slightly wide foot and she appreciates the fit of KEEN. I love the roomy toe box for complete comfort as I run errands or go out in nature. . We live in Southern Oregon with lots of hiking and water . . . She loves them!!!
review.name: KEEN is a quality gift ! I have many pairs that just keep going

review.reviewBody: I wore these in Walt Disney World, walking between 8-10+hours every day for 7 days. Very comfortable and perfect for those Florida rains!!
review.name: Perfect!!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use the Keen Newport for outdoor activities. I like it for hiking and kayaking since I can wear it in the water.
This pair is a replacement for ones that I have had and used for six years.
Good wear.
review.name: Great outdoor shoe

review.reviewBody: I wanted to use them for work at my business. I think they would be awesome in the water and on land but not good on the ramp I have to get dogs in the water on. Not gripping enough and I need a lot of that to handle getting squirmy dogs into the water while not falling. I'm going to keep them as I love the fit.
review.name: I wanted to use them

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sandal style is my favorite. It’s stylish, comfortable and supportive at the same time. I especially like this color.
review.name: Love these

review.reviewBody: Please bring back wide last Venice model. I had to dig out an old, old pair of Tevas after two decades of exclusive Keen wear.
review.name: Too narrow

review.reviewBody: I am a long-time Keen sandal customer. I love the fit. What often holds me back from ordering more is color choice. This one is not loud and disgusting, as so many of them are. It goes with my clothes. I like that.
review.name: My favorite Winter Shoe in a Better-than-Expected Color Combination

review.reviewBody: Only wore them 2 times but comfy and snug in my feet.
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: Be sure to 1/2 size up as they suggested. I walk 5 miles a day in them and they are super comfy.
review.name: Love them!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Right out of the gate these were extremely comfortable! I went on a three mile hike and they stayed snug on my feet without sliding around when I was on tough terrain. Can’t say enough good things!
review.name: Love love love these

review.reviewBody: This fleece is super soft and comfortable. Fits true to size
review.name: Exactly what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: It was the right size and came quickly and my granddaughter loved it 😍
review.name: It was the right size

review.reviewBody: The fleece is very soft. I like the relaxed fit, not too tight and not too boxy. I'm 5'4" 128 lbs and ordered size S originally but had to return it for the XS because the sleeves were too long.
review.name: Soft and Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a gift and I cannot give it. It is not the quality I was expecting from Cotopaxi. I am disappointed. I did order a bag hoping the quality is up to par so I can still support this company. I am trying to stay away from fast fashion. it was very disappointing purchase though.
review.name: fleece review.

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and fits great. Got it for my wife and she loves it.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: This jacket is perfect for layering under a puff or over a long sleeve. I don’t feel suffocated by the weight or amount of fabric. The only thing is the fleece starts to flatten pretty quick on the arms.
review.name: Comfy lightweight fleece

review.reviewBody: Ordered fleece pullovers as gift. They were true to size but super thin and felt cheap. Not the quality I expected. We have been purchasing Cotopaxi before it became popular and have always been happy with our purchases until this one. We returned the items and ordered from their competitor.
review.name: Thin and poor qualkty

review.reviewBody: High quality sweater that keeps you warm while looking great.
review.name: Excellent quality

review.reviewBody: I’m very happy with my purchase, only reason for not 5 stars is thickness of fleece, but I’m only being honest… it may have been my expectation rather than looking more closely at description. Overall, great purchase and quality.
review.name: Love the style and color combo!

review.reviewBody: Not bulky, but warm! Perfect to layer or just wear as a shell.
